trans-unit.source: Used to provide design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList"></xref> Web server control.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.BulletedListDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Allows the designer to filter the set of events that the associated control will expose at design time.

Control designers use methods that are derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PostFilterEvents%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to filter the set of events that the control it is designing will expose through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object.

For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control, the PostFilterEvents method removes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.SelectedIndexChanged> event from the list that is exposed by the designer.
The keys in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface are the names of the events.
The values in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> are objects of type <xref:System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor>.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> that contains the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor"></xref> objects representing the events of the control.
The keys in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> are event names.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control that is associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.

Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> control to generate the design-time markup.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList>.
If the UsePreviewControl property were to return `false`, the designer would use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BulletedList> itself to generate the design-time markup.
